alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 7:08PM MDT until May 07 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. ...The Flood Watch is replaced by a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at Calder. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Bear Creek will begin to back up from the St Joe River and may start to spill into the town of Calder, flooding the low spots in yards, roads and parking lots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat St Joe River Calder 13.0 12.3 Wed 5 pm PDT 12.2 12.8 13.2 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM PDT.
